Akron.St. Paul's Sunday School and Parish Hous: St. Paul's Sunday School and Parish House was erected at the corner of at East Market and Forge Streets in Akron, Ohio, for $35,000 in 1884-85 by the St. Paul's Episcopal Church. It was built primarily to serve as a Sunday school and parish house, but also as a sanctuary. This building now serves as the Firestone Conservatory of Music at the University of Akron and was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1976.
